title: glad54
author: glad54
content: Hi everyone!We're building tools to track news from Twitter, Discord, Substack, etc., based on your interests. We scrape a lot of posts, like 20k tweets per day from 6k profiles, so we use AI filtration and manual filtration to find valuable posts and send them to you.There are posts from official project accounts, and there are also posts from independent individuals. This way, you can receive more important messages about hacks and exploits, and get them faster.So now we have a web version and a Telegram bot. The bot looks much simpler; however, it has more advanced filtration in comparison with the web version.We value all forms of feedback. If you know what can be done better please tell us. Thank you for your attention.

comments.author: ICYNOTE2023
comments.body: Quote from: glad54 on July 28, 2023, 04:39:02 PMHi everyone!We're building tools to track news from Twitter, Discord, Substack, etc., based on your interests. We scrape a lot of posts, like 20k tweets per day from 6k profiles, so we use AI filtration and manual filtration to find valuable posts and send them to you.There are posts from official project accounts, and there are also posts from independent individuals. This way, you can receive more important messages about hacks and exploits, and get them faster.So now we have a web version and a Telegram bot. The bot looks much simpler; however, it has more advanced filtration in comparison with the web version.We value all forms of feedback. If you know what can be done better please tell us. Thank you for your attention.maybe you made it with php source with VScode as editor. because it's better to make it in the form of a website and then it can be transmitted to telegram bots. just suggest

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: I liked the idea, but why do I need to create an account to be able to get any data? Honestly, I closed the browser after I was asked for email code. These are extra steps that are not necessary. You can ask users to create an account after they have access to a certain number of data or when they want to customize the data . What customizations can the user get? Is it related to prices, technical news, or important updates?

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: As for a website, I didn't find anything. I don't know if this is a trial version, but I tried browsing some sections and got an error when trying to open some pages.As for the Telegram bot, it seems that it is directed towards entrepreneurs and not ordinary users, as I understood from the message on the bot that this is a paid service that costs about $40 per month.In the beginning, you need to provide services that attract users, to have a good user base, and then you can use this base to direct users towards projects that pay you.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on July 31, 2023, 09:31:22 AMAs for a website, I didn't find anything. I don't know if this is a trial version, but I tried browsing some sections and got an error when trying to open some pages.Did you try on https://alphabase.ai/recent You will see a Twitter-like news feed, where posts from specific Twitter accounts and sometimes specific Telegram posts appear. OP, it's not a bad idea (I think there have already been similar attempts), but here I also ask, why is registration necessary? You can customize the content for each visitor using cookies. The advantage of such services should be reducing the need for registration on various platforms and opening accounts on many networks.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: A service that requires login should also include a clear privacy policy, unfortunately I haven't come across that so far. Also I see a list of alternative logins, one of which is using metamask, what are the access permissions required?

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on July 31, 2023, 11:29:00 AMDid you try on https://alphabase.ai/recent You will see a Twitter-like news feed, where posts from specific Twitter accounts and sometimes specific Telegram posts appear. Yes, I tried it. At first, a little news appears, but when I click on something else and then press "Recent" again, I get an error after a few seconds, as shown in the picture.                               I don't know if this error appears only to me. But when I refresh the page it works again and then the error appears again after a few seconds. Tried it several times same thing.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on July 31, 2023, 03:36:05 PMQuote from: examplens on July 31, 2023, 11:29:00 AMDid you try on https://alphabase.ai/recent You will see a Twitter-like news feed, where posts from specific Twitter accounts and sometimes specific Telegram posts appear. Yes, I tried it. At first, a little news appears, but when I click on something else and then press "Recent" again, I get an error after a few seconds, as shown in the picture.It works now, I can customize the language to English and Russian, and I can customize the social media. The site did not ask me to customize the content using cookies, and I did not find a way to customize anything.The search feature is still very random but overall, it works, I hope with continued development the results will be better as the backbone of such sites is the quality of the search algorithm.The site works in the dark mode and it is clean. If the development continues, it will be a good option for some.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 01, 2023, 03:43:44 PMIt works now, I can customize the language to English and Russian, and I can customize the social media. >>>Yes it works now but using a VPN.It seems that this was my problem from the beginning, although the site opens without a VPN, but it does not work perfectly except with a VPN. The page may be refreshed every few seconds to update the news, and this is what caused me to get an error every time.However, this will not be a big problem since most of the users use a VPN for privacy.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: I used to work on a project like this in the past. I second the suggestion to allow users to try your features first before asking them to sign-up. You can make a guest option that is tied to the user's IP with limited access for example. If you're afraid of abuse then you can add a filter or something similar. It is hard to gain new users for tracker apps afaik. I've seen at least two projects with the same idea that failed recently, mostly due to a lack of features and low appeal for users. Giving them a trial might be able to solve it to some extent.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on July 31, 2023, 09:23:49 AMI liked the idea, but why do I need to create an account to be able to get any data? Honestly, I closed the browser after I was asked for email code. These are extra steps that are not necessary. You can ask users to create an account after they have access to a certain number of data or when they want to customize the data . What customizations can the user get? Is it related to prices, technical news, or important updates?You do not need to create an account there but only visit https://alphabase.ai/recent and you will see all the related tweets or news on that page.I do not know if we can get the choice to filter out the news sources. I haven't made the account on this site so i also do not know what additional benefits we will get once we create an account there.Also the site interface needs a lot of improvement and it's really requires a revamp to a professional look.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on August 01, 2023, 03:54:15 PMYes it works now but using a VPN.This is not supposed to happen, all the data that is collected is from sources available to all, and I do not think that the site is banned in your country, there is no page for privacy or terms of use to support my position, but it is wrong that there are restrictions according to the IP address.Quote from: virasog on August 02, 2023, 04:37:35 PMI do not know if we can get the choice to filter out the news sources. I haven't made the account on this site so i also do not know what additional benefits we will get once we create an account there.There are two filters, the first is according to Trust score and the second is according to Sources. I don't know how trust works, but the results are still random.We show interest more than @OP since he did not answer any of our questions.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 02, 2023, 05:16:48 PMThis is not supposed to happen, all the data that is collected is from sources available to all, and I do not think that the site is banned in your country, there is no page for privacy or terms of use to support my position, but it is wrong that there are restrictions according to the IP address.It is also possible that OP uses a hosting website that blocks some IPs according to their blacklist. Sometimes they block regardless of what the user requests them, so it is possible that OP doesn't intend to block anyone although the chance is low since he can easily view it from his hosting control panel afaik. Kind of weird that using a VPN allows them to bypass the filter though, since most hosting would block VPN IPs most of the time.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 02, 2023, 05:16:48 PMQuote from: virasog on August 02, 2023, 04:37:35 PMI do not know if we can get the choice to filter out the news sources. I haven't made the account on this site so i also do not know what additional benefits we will get once we create an account there.There are two filters, the first is according to Trust score and the second is according to Sources. I don't know how trust works, but the results are still random.Unless and until we have a clear option to select and deselect the news sources, i don't think it will be of much interest.Think for a moment that we can scroll through twitter and get all the relevant tweets which we follow. If there was no option of "following", everyone would be getting random unwanted tweets. Same case applies on the OP website.Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 02, 2023, 05:16:48 PMWe show interest more than @OP since he did not answer any of our questions.Well, he was last active on 31 July so he did not see our messges / replies. If he ever comes back to his thread, i hope he will reply to our quieries.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on July 31, 2023, 01:06:25 PMA service that requires login should also include a clear privacy policy, unfortunately I haven't come across that so far. Also I see a list of alternative logins, one of which is using metamask, what are the access permissions required?I am totally unable to access the url. I do not know what is wrong, could it be that thy are offline or what. Op, I like the idea behind the project and when the project is well managed it will attract alot of people to the project and you will have a large user base. If you could concentrate on the project make it nice and pay less attention to money in this early stage, it will be nice.
